text: Rock Festival is a live album by The Youngbloods and was released in 1970. It reached #80 on the Billboard Top LPs chart.The Youngbloods, Rock Festival Retrieved May 21, 2015 The album featured the single "It's a Lovely Day", which did not chart.The Youngbloods, "It's a Lovely Day" single release Retrieved May 21, 2015 ==Track listing== # "It's a Lovely Day" (Jesse Colin Young) – 2:35 # "Faster All the Time" (Lowell Levinger) – 3:55 # "Prelude" (Levinger, Young) – 1:01 # "On Beautiful Lake Spenard" (Levinger) – 4:56 # "Josiane" (Young) – 5:23 # "Sea Cow Boogie" (Levinger, Young) – 0:22 # "Fiddler a Dram" (Levinger) – 5:12 # "Misty Roses" (Tim Hardin) – 4:05 # "Interlude" (Levinger) – 2:12 # "Peepin' 'N' Hidin' (Baby, What You Want Me To Do)" (Jimmy Reed) – 5:06 # "Ice Bag" (Levinger, Young) – 2:22 ==Recording dates== *March 29, 1970 (at The Family Dog on the Great Highway in San Francisco, California) *April 16, 1970 (at The Barn in Marshall, California *April 18, 1970 (at the University of Santa Clara *May 19, 1970 (at Provo Park in Berkeley, California) *July 21, 1970 (at Pacific High Recording in San Francisco, California)The Youngbloods, Rock Festival recording dates Retrieved May 21, 2015 ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" !Chart (1970) !Peak position |- |Billboard |align="center"|80 |- |} ==References== Category:1970 live albums Category:The Youngbloods albums
title: Rock Festival (album)
